alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:13PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Keokuk and northwestern Jefferson Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 312 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hayesville, or near Sigourney, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Delta around 330 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include What Cheer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
